item.title: Henri Bergius
item.description:
Henri Bergius

Hacker and an occasional adventurer. Author of Create.js and NoFlo. Decoupling software, one piece at a time.

item.title: Ethereum: Rise of the World Computer
item.description:
Ethereum: Rise of the World Computer

The Ethereum network is a distributed economy like Bitcoin, except it is much, much more powerful. The essential difference is that Ethereum is programmable. In fact, it only takes a few minutes to program a whole new currency like Bitcoin.

item.title: IPFS: The InterPlanetary File System
item.description:
IPFS: The InterPlanetary File System

The InterPlanetary File System (IPFS) is a new Open Source project whose main goal is to turn the web into a distributed system - one that is not reliant on any one server or path. I've played around with it a bit this past week and would like to share my findings.

item.title: How Driverless Cars Can Reshape Our Cities
item.description:
How Driverless Cars Can Reshape Our Cities

A potential shift to a society of riders could reclaim roadways for green space and help reshape the public realm.

item.title: Reign of the Algorithm
item.description:
Reign of the Algorithm

This is (yet another) reflection about the ways that 'Web 2.0', social media, and the mass adoption of smartphones have changed society. But first, here is the introductory, prerequisite stanza: I began blogging in 2004. MySpace was one year old. Facebook was exclusively for Harvard students.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence, Technology without Alternative? at Lift16
item.description:
Artificial Intelligence, Technology without Alternative? at Lift16

To continue the program of Friday, February 12, at Lift16, we went beyond the buzz and into the reality of AI with speakers from the USA, Germany and Switzerland in the session Artificial Intelligence, Technology without Alternative? Artificial Intelligence is hard.

item.title: Real or computer-generated: can you tell the difference?
item.description:
Real or computer-generated: can you tell the difference?

As computer-generated characters become increasingly photorealistic, people are finding it harder to distinguish between real and computer-generated, a Dartmouth College-led study has found. This has introduced complex forensic and legal issues*, such as how to distinguish between computer-generated and photographic images of child pornography, says Hany Farid, a professor of computer science, pioneering researcher in digital forensics at Dartmouth, and senior author of a paper in the journal ACM Transactions on Applied Perception.

item.title: Wikidata makes Wikipedia a database. Let the fun begin
item.description:
Wikidata makes Wikipedia a database. Let the fun begin

Aliens have invaded! They threaten to destroy the Earth, unless we can answer a simple question: What are the ten largest cities on the planet with female mayors? Where would you even begin to answer that question?

item.title: Filco MiniLa Air Bluetooth keyboard review
item.description:
Filco MiniLa Air Bluetooth keyboard review

I took the Filco MiniLa Air Bluetooth keyboard with me on vacation this year to use with a MacBook Air propped up on the fantastic Roost stand. I use the tenkeyless Filco Majestouch at home, and I was hoping for the same super-accurate, clicky-key action in this battery-powered, portable wireless version.

item.title: Henri Bergius - Websites Designed by Artificial Intelligence
item.description:
Henri Bergius - Websites Designed by Artificial Intelligence

Henri Bergius, VP engineering at The Grid, an AI that builds your website based on its content, hacker and occasional adventurer, is the creator of Create.js and NoFlo. In this second talk of the session Artificial Intelligence, Technology without Alternative?
